--------------------
Text: The Jean Cocteau House was the residence of the French poet, artist, playwright and film maker Jean Cocteau (1889–1963), which he purchased with the film actor Jean Marais in 1947, and where he created many of his later works before his death in 1963.
Triplets:<Jean Cocteau
1:
--------------------
<Text: Jean Cocteau House:  It is located about fifty kilometers south of Paris in the village of Milly-la-Forêt in the Essonne Department of France.>
Triplets:<Jean Cocteau House
2:
<Text: Jean Cocteau House:  The 16th century house was originally part of the domain of a 13th-century chateau whose moat and a ruined tower are next to the house.>
<Jean Cocteau House
4:
--------------------
<Text: Jean Cocteau House:  The house now displays furnished rooms and a museum of his work.>
Triplets:<Jean Cocteau House
5:
--------------------
Text: Jean Cocteau House:  The tomb of Cocteau, decorated with his work, is found in a small chapel, Saint Blaise des Simples, at the edge of town not from the house.
